briefdescription.para: Returns whether a string ends with the given suffix.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the string ends with the suffix

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int start, unsigned char byte, int *found)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_find_byte_backward

briefdescription.para: Find the given byte scanning backward from the given start.

detaileddescription.para: Sets *found to -1 if the byte is not found.

parameterdescription.para: the place to start scanning (will not find the byte at this point)
return location for where it was found

briefdescription.para: Initializes a string that can be up to the given allocation size before it has to realloc.

detaileddescription.para: The string starts life with zero length. The string must eventually be freed with _dbus_string_free().

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: Initializes a string.

detaileddescription.para: The string starts life with zero length. The string must eventually be freed with _dbus_string_free().

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: Initializes a constant string.

detaileddescription.para: The value parameter is not copied (should be static), and the string may never be modified. It is safe but not necessary to call _dbus_string_free() on a const string. The string has a length limit of MAXINT - 8.

parameterdescription.para: memory to use for the string
a string to be stored in str (not copied!!!)

briefdescription.para: Initializes a constant string with a length.

detaileddescription.para: The value parameter is not copied (should be static), and the string may never be modified. It is safe but not necessary to call _dbus_string_free() on a const string.

parameterdescription.para: memory to use for the string
a string to be stored in str (not copied!!!)

briefdescription.para: Initializes a string from another string.

detaileddescription.para: The string must eventually be freed with _dbus_string_free().

parameterdescription.para: instance from which the string is initialized

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: Frees a string created by _dbus_string_init().

parameterdescription.para: memory where the string is stored.

briefdescription.para: Compacts the string to avoid wasted memory.

detaileddescription.para: Wasted memory is memory that is allocated but not actually required to store the current length of the string. The compact is only done if more than the given amount of memory is being wasted (otherwise the waste is ignored and the call does nothing).

parameterdescription.para: the maximum amount of waste to ignore

simplesect.para: FALSE if the compact failed due to realloc failure

briefdescription.para: Gets a sub-portion of the raw character buffer from the string.

detaileddescription.para: The "len" field is required simply for error checking, to be sure you don't try to use more string than exists. The nul termination of the returned buffer remains at the end of the entire string, not at start + len.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int i, int n_bytes, unsigned char byte)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_insert_bytes

briefdescription.para: Inserts a number of bytes of a given value at the given position.
Inserts a single byte at the given position.
Like _dbus_string_get_data(), but removes the gotten data from the original string.

detaileddescription.para: The caller must free the data returned. This function may fail due to lack of memory, and return FALSE.

briefdescription.para: Copies the data from the string into a char*.

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on no memory

briefdescription.para: Copies the contents of a DBusString into a different buffer.

detaileddescription.para: It is a bug if avail_len is too short to hold the string contents. nul termination is not copied, just the supplied bytes.

parameterdescription.para: a C buffer to copy data to

briefdescription.para: Copies the contents of a DBusString into a different buffer.

detaileddescription.para: It is a bug if avail_len is too short to hold the string contents plus a nul byte.

parameterdescription.para: a C buffer to copy data to

briefdescription.para: Makes a string longer by the given number of bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether adding additional_length to the current length would overflow an integer, and checks for exceeding a string's max length. The new bytes are not initialized, other than nul-terminating the end of the string. The uninitialized bytes may contain nul bytes or other junk.

parameterdescription.para: length to add to the string.

briefdescription.para: Makes a string shorter by the given number of bytes.

parameterdescription.para: length to remove from the string.

briefdescription.para: Sets the length of a string.

detaileddescription.para: Can be used to truncate or lengthen the string. If the string is lengthened, the function may fail and return FALSE. Newly-added bytes are not initialized, as with _dbus_string_lengthen().

briefdescription.para: Align the length of a string to a specific alignment (typically 4 or 8) by appending nul bytes to the string.
Preallocate extra_bytes such that a future lengthening of the string by extra_bytes is guaranteed to succeed without an out of memory error.
Appends a nul-terminated C-style string to a DBusString.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int insert_at, const unsigned char octets[2])
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_insert_2_aligned

briefdescription.para: Inserts 2 bytes aligned on a 2 byte boundary with any alignment padding initialized to 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int insert_at, const unsigned char octets[4])
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_insert_4_aligned

briefdescription.para: Inserts 4 bytes aligned on a 4 byte boundary with any alignment padding initialized to 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusString *str, int insert_at, const unsigned char octets[8])
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_insert_8_aligned

briefdescription.para: Inserts 8 bytes aligned on an 8 byte boundary with any alignment padding initialized to 0.
Inserts padding at *insert_at such to align it to the given boundary.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the padding to nul bytes. Sets *insert_at to the aligned position.

briefdescription.para: Appends a printf-style formatted string to the DBusString.
Appends a printf-style formatted string to the DBusString.
Appends block of bytes with the given length to a DBusString.

parameterdescription.para: the number of bytes to append

briefdescription.para: Appends a single byte to the string, returning FALSE if not enough memory.
Deletes a segment of a DBusString with length len starting at start.

detaileddescription.para: (Hint: to clear an entire string, setting length to 0 with _dbus_string_set_length() is easier.)

parameterdescription.para: the number of bytes to delete

briefdescription.para: Moves the end of one string into another string.

detaileddescription.para: Both strings must be initialized, valid strings.

where to move the chopped-off part of source string

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *source, int start, DBusString *dest, int insert_at)

briefdescription.para: Like _dbus_string_move(), but does not delete the section of the source string that's copied to the dest string.

where to place the copied part of source string

briefdescription.para: Like _dbus_string_move(), but can move a segment from the middle of the source string.

where to move the bytes from the source string

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *source, int start, int len, DBusString *dest, int insert_at)

briefdescription.para: Like _dbus_string_copy(), but can copy a segment from the middle of the source string.

parameterdescription.para: where to start copying the source string
where to place the copied segment of source string

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *source, int start, int len, DBusString *dest, int replace_at, int replace_len)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_replace_len

briefdescription.para: Replaces a segment of dest string with a segment of source string.

parameterdescription.para: where to start copying the source string
start of segment of dest string to replace
length of segment of dest string to replace

briefdescription.para: Looks for the first occurance of a byte, deletes that byte, and moves everything after the byte to the beginning of a separate string.

detaileddescription.para: Both strings must be initialized, valid strings.

parameterdescription.para: the byte to remove and split the string at

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory or if byte could not be found

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int start, const char *substr, int *found)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_find

briefdescription.para: Finds the given substring in the string, returning TRUE and filling in the byte index where the substring was found, if it was found.

detaileddescription.para: Returns FALSE if the substring wasn't found. Sets *start to the length of the string if the substring is not found.

parameterdescription.para: return location for where it was found, or NULL

briefdescription.para: Finds end of line ("\r\n" or "\n") in the string, returning TRUE and filling in the byte index where the eol string was found, if it was found.

detaileddescription.para: Returns FALSE if eol wasn't found.

parameterdescription.para: return location for where eol was found or string length otherwise
return length of found eol string or zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int start, int end, const char *substr, int *found)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_find_to

briefdescription.para: Finds the given substring in the string, up to a certain position, returning TRUE and filling in the byte index where the substring was found, if it was found.

detaileddescription.para: Returns FALSE if the substring wasn't found. Sets *start to the length of the string if the substring is not found.

parameterdescription.para: return location for where it was found, or NULL

briefdescription.para: Finds a blank (space or tab) in the string.

detaileddescription.para: Returns TRUE if found, FALSE otherwise. If a blank is not found sets *found to the length of the string.

parameterdescription.para: place to store the location of the first blank

simplesect.para: TRUE if a blank was found

briefdescription.para: Skips blanks from start, storing the first non-blank in *end (blank is space or tab).

parameterdescription.para: where to store the first non-blank byte index

briefdescription.para: Skips whitespace from start, storing the first non-whitespace in *end.

detaileddescription.para: (whitespace is space, tab, newline, CR).

parameterdescription.para: where to store the first non-whitespace byte index

briefdescription.para: Skips whitespace from end, storing the start index of the trailing whitespace in *start.

detaileddescription.para: (whitespace is space, tab, newline, CR).

parameterdescription.para: where to store the start of whitespace chars

briefdescription.para: Assigns a newline-terminated or \r\n-terminated line from the front of the string to the given dest string.

detaileddescription.para: The dest string's previous contents are deleted. If the source string contains no newline, moves the entire source string to the dest string.

xrefdescription.para: owen correctly notes that this is a stupid function (it was written purely for test code, e.g. dbus-message-builder.c). Probably should be enforced as test code only with ifdef DBUS_ENABLE_EMBEDDED_TESTS

simplesect.para: FALSE if no memory, or source has length 0

briefdescription.para: Deletes leading and trailing whitespace.

Tests two DBusString for equality up to the given length.

detaileddescription.para: The strings may be shorter than the given length.

simplesect.para: TRUE if equal for the given number of bytes

detaileddescription.para: The specified range of the first string must exist; the specified start position of the second string must exist.

length of substring in first string
where to start substring in second string

simplesect.para: TRUE if the two substrings are equal

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a string is equal to a C string.
Checks whether a string starts with the given C string.

simplesect.para: TRUE if string starts with it

briefdescription.para: Appends a two-character hex digit to a string, where the hex digit has the value of the given byte.

briefdescription.para: Encodes a string in hex, the way MD5 and SHA-1 are usually encoded.

detaileddescription.para: (Each byte is two hex digits.)

parameterdescription.para: string where encoded data should be placed

simplesect.para: TRUE if encoding was successful, FALSE if no memory etc.

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *source, int start, int *end_return, DBusString *dest, int insert_at)

briefdescription.para: Decodes a string from hex encoding.

parameterdescription.para: return location of the end of the hex data, or NULL
string where decoded data should be placed

simplesect.para: TRUE if decoding was successful, FALSE if no memory.

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is valid ASCII with no nul bytes.

detaileddescription.para: If the given range is not entirely contained in the string, returns FALSE.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is all valid ASCII

briefdescription.para: Converts the given range of the string to lower case.
Converts the given range of the string to upper case.
Checks that the given range of the string is valid UTF-8.

detaileddescription.para: If the given range is not entirely contained in the string, returns FALSE. If the string contains any nul bytes in the given range, returns FALSE. If the start and start+len are not on character boundaries, returns FALSE.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is all valid UTF-8

briefdescription.para: Checks that the given range of the string is all nul bytes.

detaileddescription.para: If the given range is not entirely contained in the string, returns FALSE.

xrefdescription.para: this is inconsistent with most of DBusString in that it allows a start,len range that extends past the string end.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte range exists and is all nul bytes

briefdescription.para: Clears all allocated bytes in the string to zero.
Get the directory name from a complete filename.

parameterdescription.para: string to append directory name to

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID matches the UID of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on Windows.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this uid owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the Windows user SID matches the owner of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on UNIX.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this user owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID is at the console.

detaileddescription.para: Should always fail on Windows (set the error to DBUS_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED).

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID is the same as the console user and there are no errors

briefdescription.para: Parse a UNIX group from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Parse a UNIX user from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Gets all groups corresponding to the given UNIX user ID.

detaileddescription.para: On UNIX, just calls _dbus_groups_from_uid(). On Windows, should always fail since we don't know any UNIX groups.

parameterdescription.para: return location for array of group IDs
return location for length of returned array

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID existed and we got some credentials

briefdescription.para: Appends an integer to a DBusString.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory or other failure.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory or other failure.

return location of the end of the integer, or NULL

memberdef.name: DBUS_STRING_COPY_PREAMBLE
memberdef.initializer: DBusRealString *real_source = (DBusRealString*) source; \ DBusRealString *real_dest = (DBusRealString*) dest; \ _dbus_assert ((source) != (dest)); \ DBUS_GENERIC_STRING_PREAMBLE (real_source); \ DBUS_GENERIC_STRING_PREAMBLE (real_dest); \ _dbus_assert (!real_dest->constant); \ _dbus_assert (!real_dest->locked); \ _dbus_assert ((start) >= 0); \ _dbus_assert ((start) <= real_source->len); \ _dbus_assert ((insert_at) >= 0); \ _dbus_assert ((insert_at) <= real_dest->len)

briefdescription.para: Checks assertions for two strings we're copying a segment between, and declares real_source/real_dest variables.

parameterdescription.para: where the copied segment is inserted

briefdescription.para: computes length and mask of a unicode character

the length variable to assign to

briefdescription.para: computes length of a unicode character in UTF-8
Gets a UTF-8 value.

parameterdescription.para: length for this char in bytes

briefdescription.para: Check whether a Unicode (5.2) char is in a valid range.

detaileddescription.para: The first check comes from the Unicode guarantee to never encode a point above 0x0010ffff, since UTF-16 couldn't represent it.
The second check covers surrogate pairs (category Cs).

briefdescription.para: DBusString data structure for safer string handling.

detaileddescription.para: Types and functions related to DBusString. DBusString is intended to be a string class that makes it hard to mess up security issues (and just in general harder to write buggy code). It should be used (or extended and then used) rather than the libc stuff in string.h. The string class is a bit inconvenient at spots because it handles out-of-memory failures and tries to be extra-robust.

A DBusString has a maximum length set at initialization time; this can be used to ensure that a buffer doesn't get too big. The _dbus_string_lengthen() method checks for overflow, and for max length being exceeded.

Try to avoid conversion to a plain C string, i.e. add methods on the string object instead, only convert to C string when passing things out to the public API. In particular, no sprintf, strcpy, strcat, any of that should be used. The GString feature of accepting negative numbers for "length of string" is also absent, because it could keep us from detecting bogus huge lengths. i.e. if we passed in some bogus huge length it would be taken to mean "current length of string" instead of "broken crack"

xrefdescription.para: DBusString needs a lot of cleaning up; some of the API is no longer used, and the API is pretty inconsistent. In particular all the "append" APIs, especially those involving alignment but probably lots of them, are no longer used by the marshaling code which always does "inserts" now.
